newsitem.title: USA: Kodak will co-brand 300-500 stores - NYT.
newsitem.headline: Kodak will co-brand 300-500 stores - NYT.

text.p: Eastman Kodak will put its name on between 300 and 500 photo specialty stores across the U.S. within the next 18 months, the New York Times reported.
Under the plan, Kodak will give retailers discounts on fixtures, will offer price promotions and will provide purchase displays, marketing advice and staff training, the paper said.
In return, retailers will stock a full line of Kodak cameras and film and install machines that allow people to custom-create their own pictures, the paper added.
Kodak's move comes amid stiff competition from Fuji Photo Film, the paper said. This year, Fuji has eroded Kodak's share of the film market, according to the paper.
